(12/01/2009 17:57): Design.NewRenderingArchitecture was modified by xwiki:XWiki.VincentMassol - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/NewRenderingArchitecture npm - (12/01/2009 18:58): does XEM support virtual hosting with each v-host pointing to a separate database as per http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HConfigurethenamesofdatabaseschemas28since16M129 and http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Virtualization npm - (12/01/2009 18:59): and if I already have XE1.8(trunk) up and running, can I just insall http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Plugins/WikiManagerPlugin , http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/WikiManagerApplication and http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Plugins/ApplicationManagerPlugin to achieve the same result?? jvdrean - (12/01/2009 18:59): npm: yes and yes jvdrean - (12/01/2009 19:00): virtual hosting == one db per virtual wiki thomasmortagne - (12/01/2009 19:01): npm: you can define which v-host goes to which wiki/database in the wikis descriptors npm - (12/01/2009 19:02): thanks. will XEM support vhosting where the hosts are company1.com company2.com etc rather than company1.host.com and company2.host.com thomasmortagne - (12/01/2009 19:02): in fact WikiManager only support full host in wikis descriptor npm - (12/01/2009 19:02): the documentation suggests the latter, but it seems like you'd just match on the entire host name and not worry about it all being in the same domain thomasmortagne - (12/01/2009 19:03): so yes you can define company1.com for a wiki and company2.com or another npm - (12/01/2009 19:04): excellent. i was about to setup vhosting on my 1.8 trunk install when i noticed 1.5 xem released... wondering what i'm missing by customizing my own xe thomasmortagne - (12/01/2009 19:05): (XEM 1.5 is based on 1.7.1 not 1.8) npm - (12/01/2009 19:06): i realize that... i'm living dangerously (or i wanted to see 1.8 features) npm - (12/01/2009 19:08): in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Virtualization#Byhand it says "XWiki.XWikiServerThisdatabasename, where Thisdatabasename is the name of the Virtual Server database. THIS IS IMPORTANT: the text for This databasename MUST have it's first letter CAPITALIZED.  This is regardless of your database setup!!!!!!! " -- does this mean the page name must be capitalized, or the db created for the vhost must be capitalized?? npm - (12/01/2009 19:09): http://n2.nabble.com/Need-some-explanation-about-virtual-xwiki-td1394238.html uses lowercase, so i'm assuming only the doc'd assoc'd with the vhost database needs the  capitalization constraint. npm - (12/01/2009 19:13): NB: unless in virtual mode, don't set xwiki.db.prefix, or you get some very unhelpful error messages: ### 2009-01-10 17:31:25,132 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/] [http-127.0.0.1-8080-Processor3] WARN  util.JDBCExceptionReporter      - SQL Error: 1142, SQLState: 42000 npm - (12/01/2009 19:13): ### 2009-01-10 17:31:25,132 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/] [http-127.0.0.1-8080-Processor3] ERROR util.JDBCExceptionReporter      - SELECT command denied to user 'xwiki'@'localhost' for table 'xwikidoc' npm - (12/01/2009 19:13): ### com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 3202 in 3: Exception while reading document XWiki.XWikiPreferences npm - (12/01/2009 19:13): ### Wrapped Exception: could not load an entity: [com.xpn.xwiki.doc.XWikiDocument#104408758] npm - (12/01/2009 19:13): ### Wrapped Exception: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: SELECT command denied to user 'xwiki'@'localhost' for table 'xwikidoc' xwikibot - (12/01/2009 22:54): XWiki.damodarp was modified by XWiki.damodarp (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/damodarp
